title: DPM for institutional coordination, fast-tracked implementation to translate investments into tangible economic outcomes
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 08 (APP):Deputy Prime Minister/Foreign Minister (DPM/FM), Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar, on Tuesday emphasized the need for institutional coordination and fast-tracked implementation to translate investments into tangible economic outcomes.
The deputy prime minister chaired a meeting to review the progress of investment initiatives from friendly countries here, a DPM’s Office news release said.
Discussions focused on facilitating foreign investments in key sectors including infrastructure, energy, petroleum, and economic development.
DPM Dar reaffirmed the government’s commitment to translating investments into tangible economic outcomes.
The meeting was attended by SAPM Tariq Bajwa, Chairman SECP, Deputy Governor SBP and other senior officials.
